_comment: Configuration file for UniFi Protect Camera Privacy Button Controller
_description: Define multiple cameras with individual GPIO pins and settings

cameras.name: Bedroom
cameras._notes: Main camera - GPIO 18 for button, GPIO 24 for LED, 1 hour timeout

cameras.name: Living Room
cameras._notes: Living room - GPIO 19 for button, GPIO 25 for LED, 30 min timeout

cameras.name: Hallway
cameras._notes: No LED indicator, longer timeout for hallway

global_settings._comment: Global settings that apply to all cameras
global_settings._debounce_note: Button debounce time in seconds (prevents multiple triggers)
global_settings._polling_note: How often to check button states and timeouts (seconds)
global_settings._startup_note: Delay before starting (allows system to fully boot)
global_settings._state_note: Base path for state files (privacy_state_{camera_name}.json will be created)

_field_descriptions.name: Exact camera name as shown in UniFi Protect
_field_descriptions.gpio_pin: GPIO pin number (BCM numbering) for the button
_field_descriptions.led_pin: GPIO pin number (BCM numbering) for status LED (null to disable)
_field_descriptions.timeout_minutes: Minutes before privacy automatically disables (0 = never)
_field_descriptions.enabled: Whether this camera controller should be active

_gpio_notes.pin_numbering: Uses BCM (Broadcom) pin numbering, not physical pin numbers
_gpio_notes.button_wiring: Button should connect GPIO pin to GND (internal pull-up used)
_gpio_notes.led_wiring: LED cathode to GND, anode to GPIO pin through appropriate resistor
